title: Home Sweet Home Alone
description: After being left at home by himself for the holidays, 10-year-old Max Mercer must work to defend his home from a married couple who tries to steal back a valuable heirloom.

A fun Holiday movie that knows what it is and leans hard into it!Yes, they rehashed the same basic plot, but they added a few story twists that gave this move a bit more heart. To me, you watch this movie while gearing up to watch classic Holiday movies like the Santa Clause, The Grinch & Elf. It'll get you into the Holiday spirit. It is well cast and well done.Is it going to win awards, NO, is it an amazing movie, that is going to change the landscape of cinema, NO. But if that is what you are wanting, you're probably not watching a "Home Alone" movie. Take it for what it is and enjoy the ride it takes you on!

If you want to learn how to create a remake while leaving out every single thing that made the original worth it, watch this. No interesting characters, no decent jokes and a bunch of bad guys that you need sympathy for because they are actually good guys. Why? They managed to make every single character in this movie extremely dull, while every "joke" just screams "look at this, this is funny!". It's not, none of the forced jokes are funny. This entire thing is an embarassment to the movie industry. Half of the final battle the burglars are fighting ramdom things like a wall and a swimming pool. No boobytraps involved. Then, the end is as anticlimactic as it can be.

This movie is legitimately awful. I have no clue as to why they keep trying to make new Home Alone movies even though nobody wants them and everybody agrees that 1 and 2 are the best and the other ones are all terrible.The main kid in this movie is also just not likable at all, and the "villains" of this movie are the ones who have it bad. Instead of being comically evil villains, they're just a couple who are down on their luck and are trying to recover something stolen from them that they need to feed their family. It's not fun to watch them get sent on fire and stabbed by thumbtacks because they've done nothing wrong. They don't even want to do the robbery but they have to in order to feed their family. No idea what they were trying to do here. Instead of having the main kid be funny and likable and the villains be comically evil with hilarious things happening to them, you instead just get some **** rich kid beating the hell out of some down on their luck couple.

The biggest problem with the movie is the way it tries to take the trend of humanizing villains but doesn't realize that humanizing the robbers in a movie like this hurts the overall experience. Fact of the matter is the movie is about two people who are trying to steal their own property back after they think a kid stole it. The kid is trying to defend his house when he is left home alone. The problem is, when you have the two people begging for their lives at one point while the kid rains holy hell on them, you lose the ability to enjoy the slapstick comedy. For slapstick to work, the person has to be able to get back up from whatever level of pain being inflicted on them.
